column5: Went out of Beverton with Floyd Hales on Fri. First time with my new aquaview quad 360, what a view saw things down there that I did not know. Watched hundreds of perch move in that we could not see in the hole in 22ft. of water. A 5lb. bass and a 20 lb. laker swam past with no bite. Kept 2 jumbos for dinner.A great day on the ice!
they sure are fun I spend a lot of time just looking around with my aquavu

The quad 360 has 4 cameras so I saw the fish coming and going and in relation to the perch and a log in our viewing area! 20 and 5 were just guesses but I have been fishing and catching(weighing) for more than 40 years and those guesses were close!

That's cool that you saw a bass and laker as well.   As cool as it is to see fish you wouldn't normally think were under your hole, I often wonder how much more frustration the camera adds when you can see a bass or laker there and can't get them to bite.  I'm sure some people would see these fish on their camera and spend way too much time trying to catch a fish that really isn't interested and not spend enough time on the perch that are more easily caught.
Yes I must admit that I spent to much time looking at the t.v. but I do the same thing with my graph in the summer.
Just got to try out my Aqua View last week as well, they are cool !!!  Thanks for the report.
